body: I have the exact same problem on Linux Nobara when trying to run "npm run  tauri dev".

issue.title: Tauri fails to detect `/usr/bin/node-18` subcommand

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

When I try to run `pnpm tauri dev`, it fails and produces `error: The subcommand '/usr/bin/node-18' wasn't recognized` error.

### Reproduction

1. Open Terminal
2. Run `pnpm tauri dev` command

### Expected behavior

I expected the application to run successfully, without any error. Because I have `node-18` binary in my `/usr/bin` directory and it runs perfectly.

### Platform and versions

```text
`npm run tauri info` command is giving the same error.

OS: Fedora 37 Workstation
Node version: 18.5.0
Npm version: 9.4.0
Pnpm version: 7.26.3
Cargo version: 1.67.0
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Other information

While looking at #6427 I noticed the regex for the node version was [1-9], but according to the [nodejs release schedule](https://github.com/nodejs/Release) v20 will release on the 18th, and this regex will not work for node version 20.

issue.title: [bug] `npm run tauri dev` and similar commands failing after upgrading to Fedora 38

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

After upgrading from Fedora 37 to Fedora 38 I now get the following error when running `npm run tauri dev`

```
$ npm run tauri dev

> tauri
> tauri dev

error: The subcommand '/usr/bin/node-18' wasn't recognized

Usage: cargo-tauri [OPTIONS] <COMMAND>

For more information try '--help'
```

### Reproduction

1. Use a system with Fedora 38
2. Install all dependency for Tauri
3. Find a Tauri project that uses `npm`. For reference I used my project (https://github.com/R2NorthstarTools/FlightCore/) at commit `a74785bb9e6300b0baeb4f92aa647e3b498f7d0b`
4. Install dependencies with `npm install`
5. Run `npm run tauri dev`
6. You should the error message above with `error: The subcommand '/usr/bin/node-18' wasn't recognized`

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Platform and versions

```text
`npm run tauri info` gives the same error

$ npm run tauri info

> tauri
> tauri info

error: The subcommand '/usr/bin/node-18' wasn't recognized

Usage: cargo-tauri [OPTIONS] <COMMAND>

For more information try '--help'
```
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

While researching this issue I also came across this thread: https://discussion.fedoraproject.org/t/after-upgrading-to-fedora-38-i-cant-build-any-tauri-apps-that-need-nodejs/46945/

issue.title: Cannot build FlightCore on Fedora 38

labels.name: waiting on upstream
labels.description: The issue is upstream and is awaiting patching there

issue.body:
Due to an issue with Tauri detecting the npm version, FlightCore currently cannot be built on Fedora 38.

See also
- https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/6759
- https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/6427
- https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/pull/6432

Should be [resolved with `v1.3` release of Tauri](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/6759#issuecomment-1516227982).

body:
I'm also having this problem on Fedora 37:
```
@lost  ~/../project  tauri dev
bash: tauri: command not found...
@lost  ~/../project 460ms npx tauri dev
error: The subcommand '/usr/bin/node-18' wasn't recognized

Usage: cargo-tauri [OPTIONS] <COMMAND>

For more information try '--help'
@lost  ~/project 467ms ls /usr/bin/node-18 
 /usr/bin/node-18
```

> I'm also having this problem on Fedora 37:
> ```
> @lost  ~/../project  tauri dev
> bash: tauri: command not found...
> @lost  ~/../project 460ms npx tauri dev
> error: The subcommand '/usr/bin/node-18' wasn't recognized
> 
> Usage: cargo-tauri [OPTIONS] <COMMAND>
> 
> For more information try '--help'
> @lost  ~/project 467ms ls /usr/bin/node-18 
>  /usr/bin/node-18
> ```

It was fixed in the related PR, although I'm not sure if a new version including the changes was released or not. Using `fnm` to install Node acts as a quick fix until then.

> It was fixed in the related PR, although I'm not sure if a new version including the changes was released or not

Not quite yet, but really soon.

I had a alias that made the command `tauri` be something else. I used `yarn
tauri <command>` and it worked.
